creator: Julie Bort
title: (No AI) Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff: This isn’t our first SaaSpocalypse
dc:creator: Julie Bort
content: Salesforce reported a solid year-end earnings and then pulled out all the stops to ward off more talk of the death of its business to AI.
contentSnippet: Salesforce reported a solid year-end earnings and then pulled out all the stops to ward off more talk of the death of its business to AI.

creator: Jagmeet Singh
title: (No AI) Gushwork bets on AI search for customer leads — and early results are emerging
dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
content: Gushwork has raised $9 million in a seed round led by SIG and Lightspeed. The startup has seen early customer traction from AI search tools like ChatGPT.
contentSnippet: Gushwork has raised $9 million in a seed round led by SIG and Lightspeed. The startup has seen early customer traction from AI search tools like ChatGPT.

title: (No AI) Trump claims tech companies will sign deals next week to pay for their own power supply
author: Justine Calma
content:
![An image of Trump](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2025/02/STK466_ELECTION_2024_CVirginia_E.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

President Donald Trump tried to quell Americans' concerns about rising electricity costs during his State of the Union speech - and now we're learning that the deals he promised could land next week. Trump claimed that he's negotiated a "rate payer protection pledge" with major tech companies, which would see them build out or pay for new electricity generation for their data centers. Leaders from Amazon, Google, Meta, Microsoft, xAI, Oracle and OpenAI are expected to attend a March 4th event to sign the pledge, [_Fox News_ reported today](https://www.foxnews.com/politics/scoop-trump-brings-big-tech-white-house-curb-power-costs-amid-ai-boom).

There are very few details at this point on what the pledge entails, nor how companies would be held ac …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/science/884191/ai-data-center-energy-state-of-the-union-trump)
contentSnippet:
President Donald Trump tried to quell Americans' concerns about rising electricity costs during his State of the Union speech - and now we're learning that the deals he promised could land next week. Trump claimed that he's negotiated a "rate payer protection pledge" with major tech companies, which would see them build out or pay for new electricity generation for their data centers. Leaders from Amazon, Google, Meta, Microsoft, xAI, Oracle and OpenAI are expected to attend a March 4th event to sign the pledge, Fox News reported today.  
There are very few details at this point on what the pledge entails, nor how companies would be held ac …
Read the full story at The Verge.

Trump claimed that he's negotiated a "rate payer protection pledge" with major tech companies, which would see them build out or pay […]

title: (No AI) Google and Samsung just launched the AI features Apple couldn’t with Siri
author: Jay Peters
content:
![A photo of Sameer Samat at Samsung Unpacked 2026.](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2026/02/lcimg-6fdca68e-7b7c-4906-b67b-32a94211dc36.jpeg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

Google just announced that Gemini will soon be able to take care of some multistep tasks on your phone, like ordering food or hailing a car, starting first with the Pixel 10, Pixel 10 Pro, and the just-announced Samsung Galaxy S26 phones. It all sounds a bit like features Apple announced for Siri way back at the 2024 Worldwide Developers Conference - before Apple delayed those planned features in March 2025 and _which still aren't released_.

Onstage, Sameer Samat, Google's president of Android, showed off a demo of how Gemini's new agentic features would work to help wrangle a pizza dinner order from his busy family group chat. Samat asks Gem …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/tech/884703/google-samsung-galaxy-s26-gemini-apple-siri)

Onstage, Sameer Samat, Google's president of Android, showed off a demo of how Gemini's new agentic features would work to help wrangle a pizza dinner order from his busy family group chat. Samat asks Gem …

title: (No AI) Disrupting malicious uses of AI | February 2026
content: Our latest threat report examines how malicious actors combine AI models with websites and social platforms—and what it means for detection and defense.

title: (No AI) Arvind KC appointed Chief People Officer

title: (No AI) Gemini 3.1 Pro: A smarter model for your most complex tasks
content: 3.1 Pro is designed for tasks where a simple answer isn’t enough.

title: (No AI) A new way to express yourself: Gemini can now create music
content: The Gemini app now features our most advanced music generation model Lyria 3, empowering anyone to make 30-second tracks using text or images.
contentSnippet: The Gemini app now features our most advanced music generation model Lyria 3, empowering anyone to make 30-second tracks using text or images.

creator: Maxwell Zeff, Maddy Varner
title: (No AI) Riley Walz, the Jester of Silicon Valley, Is Joining OpenAI
dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff, Maddy Varner
content: The software engineer is famous for his online stunts. Now he’s joining the company behind ChatGPT to work on new ways for humans to use AI systems.
contentSnippet: The software engineer is famous for his online stunts. Now he’s joining the company behind ChatGPT to work on new ways for humans to use AI systems.

creator: Reece Rogers
title: (No AI) OpenClaw Users Are Allegedly Bypassing Anti-Bot Systems
dc:creator: Reece Rogers
content: An open source project called Scrapling is gaining traction with AI agent users who want their bots to scrape sites without permission.
contentSnippet: An open source project called Scrapling is gaining traction with AI agent users who want their bots to scrape sites without permission.
